articles.headline: Putin Gambit Over Syria Proves to Be Dual-Edged Sword
articles.snippet: Vladimir V. Putin’s air campaign has helped him politically, but it has also come at great expense: in Russian lives, resources and a dangerous clash with Turkey.
articles.abstract: Vladimir V. Putin’s air campaign has helped him politically, but it has also come at great expense: in Russian lives, resources and a dangerous clash with Turkey.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Eleven weeks after Moscow launched its first airstrikes in Syria, the scream of Russian warplanes has become so familiar in rebel-held areas that even children recognize it. But the military map of the conflict has changed little, and the Kremlin’s forces have become another set of players in a civil war that seems to defy solution.

articles.headline: Thaw in China-Russia Relations Hasn’t Trickled Down
articles.snippet: The challenges of businesses in Blagoveshchensk, Russia, and Heihe, China, highlight how far the countries need to progress to decrease dependence on the United States and Europe.
articles.abstract: The challenges of businesses in Blagoveshchensk, Russia, and Heihe, China, highlight how far the countries need to progress to decrease dependence on the United States and Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLAGOVESHCHENSK, Russia — Lured by warming relations between the two countries, Li Lihua, a Chinese entrepreneur, has invested all of her money in this frigid Russian outpost on the border with her country. She has opened Chinese restaurants, purchased factories and started a $120 million housing project to build affordable apartments aimed at young, upwardly mobile Russians.

articles.headline: Preparing to Raise Rates, Fed Underestimates Benefits of More Inflation
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates this week, but waiting until inflation rises would give the Fed more room to respond to a recession.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates this week, but waiting until inflation rises would give the Fed more room to respond to a recession.
articles.lead_paragraph: This is going to sound like anathema to all those economists who lived through the inflation of the 1970s, but there’s a good case for trying to double the inflation rate.

articles.headline: Retailers Feel the Heat of Lost Winter Clothing Sales
articles.snippet: Purchases of boots, coats and other cold-weather items are down significantly, and steep discounts are in the forecast as stores try to move their merchandise.
articles.abstract: Purchases of boots, coats and other cold-weather items are down significantly, and steep discounts are in the forecast as stores try to move their merchandise.
articles.lead_paragraph: High above the pedestrians milling about Herald Square in light coats and jackets, Stuart Greenberg, a seller of luxury furs, fondly recalled chilly Decembers past.

articles.headline: Battered, Apologetic and Still Pitching Their Hedge Funds
articles.snippet: Even billionaire hedge fund managers with sterling records have been unable to avoid heavy losses in 2015.
articles.abstract: Even billionaire hedge fund managers with sterling records have been unable to avoid heavy losses in 2015.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has been a bruising year for hedge funds. Not even billionaire managers with sterling records were able to escape heavy losses, and several among them have made the industry’s list of worst performers. Some lost so much of their investors’ money this year that they have written apology letters.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: In Republican Debate, Donald Trump and Marco Rubio Become Targets
articles.snippet: The candidates united to attack Mr. Trump’s plan to bar Muslims, and Mr. Rubio faced tough questions about his conservative credentials and his judgment.
articles.abstract: The candidates united to attack Mr. Trump’s plan to bar Muslims, and Mr. Rubio faced tough questions about his conservative credentials and his judgment.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump came under sustained attack from Jeb Bush and other Republican presidential candidates on Tuesday night as they united against his plan to bar Muslims from entering the United States while tussling over who would be toughest in protecting Americans from terrorist threats.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Volkswagen Loans Investigated by E.U. Anti-Fraud Office
articles.snippet: Officials are looking into whether the German carmaker misused funds from the European Investment Bank to develop cleaner engines.
articles.abstract: Officials are looking into whether the German carmaker misused funds from the European Investment Bank to develop cleaner engines.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — European anti-fraud investigators said on Wednesday that they were looking into whether Volkswagen misused hundreds of millions of dollars in low-interest loans — threatening a significant source of funding for the crisis-struck automaker.
